icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Barracks with ammo.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Barracks with ammo.

icon_detached.name: button1
icon_detached.description: Assign this squad to the day shift.

icon_detached.name: button2
icon_detached.description: Assign this squad to the night shift.

icon_detached.name: Pistol
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Pistols.

icon_detached.name: Musket
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Improvised Muskets.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Improvised Musket Locker.

icon_detached.name: Blunderbuss
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Blunderbusses.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Blunderbuss Locker.

icon_detached.name: Jezail
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Jezail Rifles.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Jezail Locker.

icon_detached.name: Tripistol
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Ceramic Tripistols.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Ceramic Tripistol Locker.

icon_detached.name: Revolver
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Revolvers.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Revolver Locker.

icon_detached.name: Carbine
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Carbines.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Carbine Locker.

icon_detached.name: Grenade Launcher
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Grenade Launchers.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Grenade Launcher Locker.

icon_detached.name: Leyden Pistol
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Leyden Pistols.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Leyden Pistol Locker.

icon_detached.name: Leyden Rifle
icon_detached.description: Soldiers assigned to this barracks will use Leyden Rifles.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Requires installation of a Leyden Rifle Locker.

command_button.name: Rally Squad
command_button.description: Rally a military squad to the chosen location.

icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Naturalist's Office.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Naturalist's Office.

icon_detached.name: dump
icon_detached.description: Dump or destroy the remains of unnatural beings and pretend they don't exist.

icon_detached.name: harvest
icon_detached.description: Harvest the remains of unnatural beings for resources.

icon_detached.name: study
icon_detached.description: Study the remains of unnatural beings to assist Science and to improve our Standing in the Empire and amongst other Nations.

icon_detached.name: scout
icon_detached.description: Explore: The Naturalist will scout the local area with greatly increased sight radius.

icon_detached.name: survey
icon_detached.description: Mineral Survey: The Naturalist and workcrew will survey designated ore veins to reveal their contents, or will survey randomly if left to their own devices.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Minerological Surveys require installation of a Standing Desk.

icon_detached.name: hunt
icon_detached.description: Hunting: The Naturalist and workcrew will hunt nearby wildlife. If they cannot find any animals to hunt, they will attempt to flush out wild game.
icon_detached.ifDisabledTooltipString: Hunting requires installation of an Improvised Musket Locker.

command_button.name: Explore
command_button.description: Select particular locations to target for exploring. Requires that the Naturalist have Scouting selected.

command_button.name: Conduct Mineralogical Survey (player order)
command_button.description: Select a particular Ore Beacon for a mineralogical survey to be performed. Requires that the Naturalist have Mineralogical Surveying selected.

command_button.name: Hunt Animals
command_button.description: Select particular animals to target for hunting. Requires that the Naturalist have Hunting selected.

icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Barbershop.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Barbershop.

icon_detached.name: button1
icon_detached.description: Serve brewed booze such as beer, wine, and chicha to improve mood in the colony.

icon_detached.name: button2
icon_detached.description: Serve high-alchohol spirits such as whisky to help colonists forget their troubles.

icon_detached.name: button1
icon_detached.description: Serve extremely potent Laudanum to your colonists to make them forget their pain, troubles, despair, and any will to resist your orders.

icon_detached.name: button2
icon_detached.description: Stop serving Laudanum to your colonists.

icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Mine with shorings.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Mine with shorings.

icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Laboratory.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Laboratory.

icon_detached.name: agriculture
icon_detached.description: Focus on the research of new Crops and Cooking Methods.

icon_detached.name: colonyProduction
icon_detached.description: Focus on the research of New Modules and methods of production, including Advanced Technologies.

icon_detached.name: military
icon_detached.description: Focus on developing new Weaponry and enhance your Military Personnel.

icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Foreign Office with Crates of Paperwork.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Foreign Office with Crates of Paperwork.

icon_detached.name: Empire
icon_detached.description: Focus efforts on the Clockwork Empire, whose rolling hills, smoking factories, and wise Queen we all know and love with all our being.

icon_detached.name: Stahlmark
icon_detached.description: Focus efforts on Stahlmark, those strictly disciplined lovers of beer and sauerkraut.

icon_detached.name: Novorus
icon_detached.description: Focus efforts on Novorus, rich in resources, ruled by their autocratic Tzar from his fortress-train.

icon_detached.name: Republique
icon_detached.description: Focus efforts on the Republique Mecanique, a land of republican revolution ruled by a thinking machine.

icon_detached.name: Bandits
icon_detached.description: Focus efforts on the local Bandits, because maybe we can convince them not to be so awful.

icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Academy.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Academy.

icon_detached.name: button1
icon_detached.description: Carpentry skill improves work speed in the Carpentry Workshops.

icon_detached.name: button2
icon_detached.description: Naturalism skill makes your overseers better at Naturalist's Office jobs as well as standard foraging/chopping.

icon_detached.name: button3
icon_detached.description: Smithing skill improves the speed of smelting and forging activities done in the Metalworks.

icon_detached.name: button4
icon_detached.description: Stoneworking improves the speed of Ceramics Workshop crafting as well as both surface and underground mining.

icon_detached.name: button5
icon_detached.description: Cooking increases the speed at which your Kitchen workers produce food.

icon_detached.name: button6
icon_detached.description: Science skill improves the ability of an Overseer to research new Technologies in the Laboratory.

icon_detached.name: button7
icon_detached.description: Farming skill improves an Overseer's farming speed.

icon_detached.name: on
icon_detached.description: Supply this Chapel with devotional cogs.

icon_detached.name: off
icon_detached.description: Stop supplying this Chapel with devotional cogs.

icon_detached.name: button1
icon_detached.description: Clockworkian Ecumenism involves avoiding strong opinions while awkwardly apologizing whenever controvery arises - its pleasing platitudes lack focus but are considered comforting by all sorts.

icon_detached.name: button2
icon_detached.description: The Unreformed Episcopal Deists are a hierarchical, disciplined sect that praise the virtue of physical suffering and the rational ordering of Creation. Their fatalistic, authoritarian creed is popular in military camps.

icon_detached.name: button3
icon_detached.description: The Muscular Ecclesiasticists promote hard labor and attention to detail as devotional acts to the Creator. Their monologues stir overseers to hone their craft, but take a toll on the mind.

icon_detached.name: button4
icon_detached.description: The Predestinational Mechanist sect espouses the virtues of the pursuit of rational knowledge and the intrinsic, self-evident nobility which results from already being noble. Their recitations assure diplomats, scientists, and upper class that their superiority is the only possible logical result of the first conditions of Creation.
